LanguageData.VLW_Bread.label: bread
LanguageData.VLW_Bread.description: Bread is prepared from a dough of flour and water, usually by baking. Throughout recorded history it has been a prominent food in large parts of the world and is one of the oldest man-made foods.
LanguageData.VLW_Cake.label: cake
LanguageData.VLW_Cake.description: Cake is a form of sweet dessert that is typically baked. In its oldest forms, cakes were modifications of breads; typical cake ingredients are flour, eggs, a liquid and leavening agents, such as baking soda or baking powder. Common additional ingredients and flavourings include cocoa and extracts such as vanilla.
LanguageData.VLW_Hardtack.label: hardtack
LanguageData.VLW_Hardtack.description: Hardtack is a simple type of biscuit or cracker, made from flour, water, and sometimes salt. While inexpensive and long-lasting, it tastes really bland. Used for sustenance in the absence of perishable foods, commonly during long sea voyages, land migrations, and military campaigns.
